definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: a kind of vessel, basin or basket (?; others basket-like, basket-shaped vessel); only pl. cstr. [[אֲגַרְטְלֵי זׇהָב]], & [[כֶסֶף]] ´[[א]], both Ezr 1:9, denoting vessels from temple at Jerus. restored by Cyrus. (Etym. & mng. dub. cf. supr.; A LXXL Codd. LXX of yukth=rev, wine-coolers; B om.; now commonly compared with Aram. [[קַרְטָלִיתָא]] Levy NHWB:iv. 376, qart.olo0, Ar. qirt.al=ah;un, qiet.a0lah;un, supposed to be loan-word fr. Hellenist. Gk. ka/rtalov, ka/rtallov (e.g. LXX 2Ki 10:7, Heb. [[דּוּדִים]]), all = basket, fruit-basket, etc., canistrum (so MV BeRy SS); but ka/rtallov itself is possibly a Pers. or Shemit. loan-word; cf. esp. Frä:77 f.; further conject. in Thes BeRy.)
